comments.commentBody:
The below extract is nothing but hearsay and innuendo without naming names of specifics. This smells of rumor mongering and not journalism. Mr. Sessions was approached once at the end of a speech by a group of diplomats who thanked him for his presentation and his attendance, among this group was the Russian ambassador, with no other interaction and the second meeting was with the Russian ambassador while Senator Sessions was a member of the Senate Armed Forces Committee and this was an official contact with no discussion about the election or campaign.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
The nature of the contacts remains unknown. Several of Mr. Trump’s associates have done business in Russia, and it is unclear if any of the contacts were related to business dealings.

The New York Times, citing four current and former officials, reported last month that the American authorities had obtained information of repeated contacts between Mr. Trump’s associates and senior Russian intelligence officials. The White House has dismissed the story as false.

Since the Feb. 14 article appeared, more than a half-dozen officials have confirmed contacts of various kinds between Russians and Trump associates. The label “intelligence official” is not always cleanly applied in Russia, where ex-spies, oligarchs and government officials often report back to the intelligence services and elsewhere in the Kremlin.

Now, were does Comey fit in all of this. No problem blasting to everyone about the Clinton investigation, not a word about the Russia investigation. Tell me what was more important for the American people to know before they voted. Why did the FBI want Clinton taken down? Why did Obama feel he had to hide the Trump information?

"Obama Administration Rushed to MANUFACTURE Intelligence of Russian Election Hacking"

Fixed it.
If politicians and media were principled, this wouldn't be a problem. Enough blame to go around all parties and all media. It's time to stop or the country won't make it to 250 years.

Now I get why Trump had so much trouble looking at the Dems, and all those women in white, without casting accusative glares of unfairness at their feet.

I would LOVE to play poker with this chump. He is so guilty. Hey, Trump, telegraph me another one! Whenever he gets blamey, you know we got another dump coming.
I'm often thinking about the Manchurian candidate lately.  You have to wonder if Bannon wasn't somehow brainwashed by the Russians and found a perfect piece of putty in DT. Shower him with praise.

Attorney General Jeff Sessions lied to Congress - period! He must resign immediately.

Session secretly met with the Russian ambassador -- at the same time Russia was trying to influence our election.

Even worse, during his confirmation process, multiple senators asked Sessions if he had met with Russian officials during the campaign. Sessions said flat out that he hadn’t -- and now we know he wasn’t telling the truth.

Sessions cannot continue to lead the Department of Justice. Michael Flynn already had to resign as NSA Director over secret communications with Russian officials and for misleading VP Pence about it. But the DOJ will oversee investigation of the Trump campaign’s ties to Russia -- and it can’t do that credibly under Sessions’ leadership.

Sessions must immediately resign as Attorney General.

And I add this: What did President Trump know and when did he know it? A Special Prosecutor MUST be appointed IMMEDIATELY to examine ties, communications and connections among Trump, his campaign and his administration to Russia - both before the election, after the election and before he was sworn into office, and after he was inaugurated.

This is a matter of our national security.

Did Session lie under oath in congress during confirmation hearing? How many Russian moles are planted in our government and congress? A thorough independent transparent investigation is MUST and should be started today, sooner the better. Black smoke is covering White House and government . We want to know that it is only smoke or there is any fire.

Just more treachery by internal leftist operatives.  Has anyone lost sight of the fact that tossing this kind of data about is illegal?  I suppose this behavior will have to run it's course, but the danger it poses will not be lost on the american people.  It will have an impact going forward.

What do you mean with "recuse"
If he lied then he resigns
Why this administration can get away with everything?
Is that the example we give our youth?
You lie and that's ok?
Shame !

First Flynn, now Sessions, my God we are but 6 weeks out from Trump becoming president and already hard evidence surfaces almost daily of what a swamp like administration we have. The sad part is anyone following the events in the months leading up to election day could tell from the "leaking of DNC and other communications' that there were influences at work..... (in the 70's it was called a breakin - later... Watergate).... but many still voted for Trump!

Jeff Sessions lies under oath about any contacts with Russia leading up to the election... our previous President (Obama) feels compelled to leave important discoveries made by Intelligence Organizations with various sources because he is concerned what will happen once Trump is in office. Spicer checks all cell phones for calls made.... my God - where is Harrison Ford - this could only happen on a movie screen... please shake me - this can't be happening in our country. We have all been asleep too long.

Stunning to learn that Mr. Sessions would blatantly lie to Congress. How could he have imagined he would not get caught? What else is he covering up and where is this leading? He has to resign immediately. This is really much worse than Watergate.

Is our government compromised by Russia?

The crescendo of leaks and information about Trump's and his campaign's contacts and ties to Russia is building.  While he and the Republicans are engaged in a desperate cover-up, three Russian ambassadors are suddenly dead.  This is not leaked emails, this is a conspiracy to attack our democratic systems.  A careful and thorough investigation is critically important.  In the meantime Sessions has lied to Congress, he should resign.

Trump and Co. are as crooked as they come. Deeply in bed with the Ruskies, money laundering, shady real estate deals, and all the rest. If Trump is so innocent, what does he have to fear from an independent investigation?
Let's get to the bottom of this!

Silly question. Would the Russians have been welcome to lobby at the DNC Convention? I mean, if they hadn't been so stupid as to get behind a Trumpet for a mole who blew the lid off their little tea pot. Would that have been Kosher? Because I don't think Russians get more than shade from any Dem I know unless they need aide fighting same hacking and fake news practices.

Not a fair question, whether the Dems would have ceded the Crimea to Putin had they been offered his blood money. Did the GOP? My understanding is the Russians invested in Congressional races, too.

replies.commentBody: The standard is, don't lie to congress. Sessions did. Is that hard to get? He should resign and be prosecuted.

comments.commentBody:
Is the new standard that no public official can have a conversation of any sort with an ambassador of a nation with which we maintain diplomatic relations lest she or he be disqualified from a future cabinet Post?

The Times is squandering what is left of its tattered reputation by chasing after every bunny the sore-lower Democrat operativeslur release.

Please straighten up and fly right.

"False allegations, partisan attempts to undercut Trump, fake news, I never met...."  These are familiar words to us by know, as echoed by Paul Mannafort, then Mike Flynn.  I have a feeling the dominoes won't stop at Jeff Sessions either.  This is not going to go away. No matter how desperately the current administration attempts to distract

Hey everyone, I've found the needle...

"Former senior Obama administration officials said that none of the efforts were directed by Mr. Obama."

Haystack: This article may or may not be true.
Needle: But don't credit or blame Obama for anything

I can't enjoy the idea of anyone getting RICO'd for trying to protest THIS crook which my state now endorses, but images of Our Gang re-decorating Trump's weekend work place look marvelous in my home movie house. When no one with the skill set will answer your ads...

"Get that lawn mower over here; this carpet is way to shaggy."
"Who do this man think he is, the King of Angleland?"
May be the greatest thing Obama did for the country. Stinks everywhere. Can't get rid of it. No wonder, Trump calls it mess.

President Obama knowingly or unknowingly ran a "blue-dye" operation on Team Trump.  Sanctioning Russia at the end of 2016 got Flynn on the horn to his Muscovite buddies and kept the spotlight on this whole affair.

Thanks, Obama aides for preserving intelligence about some very suspicious activities.   Luckily those aides can be called to testify about where to find it to those on committes to investigate Trump.  Quick and good thinking.

So puppet trump got new clothes and became a talking head, that is all.
trump blames the generals for a Navy Seal's death while puffing himself up over a solder's Widow.
The trump blame continues, trump attacks on new media still continue and trump supporters hate of anyone that doesn't whorship their master is undiminished.
He must attack in order to feel good and get himself worked up - hope he does not have this issue when performing his marital duties as a husband.
Again, all we saw was a campaign ad staged in the House chamber, no substance, no facts, no nothing!
Many of the voters, despite the polls, did not fall for this next level of the con - nothing has changed and we still do not trust you.

Colluded? Conspired? Discussed? Had contact with?

What does that mean?

Did Trump give the Russians the password to access DNC servers? No: a Democrat operative did that by mistake, a dumb mistake.

If Trump had said, Vlad, please hack her emails, and Vlad said ok, give me the password ... wait a minute, Trump didn't have the password ... "inviting" without being able to open the door is not illegal under any law. No means, no opportunity - motive only.

Case closed.

You folks better worry about how to revive the moribund Democratic Party. This is a dead end. A distraction for you. But keep going: it will all make it easier for Trump to enact his policies.
No wonder Trump hates Saturday Night Live so much - thanks Al.
